sections.heading: Time Adverbs
sections.content:
Time adverbs express when an action occurs, answering the question "when?" They include expressions for now, past, future, specific times, and general time periods. These adverbs help establish temporal context in Japanese sentences.

今行く "I'll go now" 昨日映画を見た "I watched a movie yesterday" 明日会いましょう "Let's meet tomorrow"

children.heading: 今 (Now)
children.content: 今行く "I'll go now" 今忙しい "I'm busy now" 今から始める "I'll start from now" Current moment Immediate present

children.heading: 今日 (Today)
children.content: 今日は暑い "It's hot today" 今日何をする？ "What will you do today?" The current day

children.heading: 現在 (Currently - Formal)
children.content: 現在、東京に住んでいます "I currently live in Tokyo" 現在進行中です "Currently in progress" Formal contexts Official statements

children.heading: 昨日 (Yesterday)
children.content: 昨日映画を見た "I watched a movie yesterday" 昨日は雨だった "It was rainy yesterday" The day before today

children.heading: 昨夜/夕べ (Last night)
children.content: 昨夜よく寝た "I slept well last night" 夕べは遅く帰った "I returned late last night" Previous evening

children.heading: おととい (The day before yesterday)
children.content: おととい買い物した "I went shopping the day before yesterday" Two days ago

children.heading: 先週 (Last week)
children.content: 先週旅行した "I traveled last week" 先週の金曜日 "Last Friday" Previous week

children.heading: 先月 (Last month)
children.content: 先月日本に行った "I went to Japan last month" Previous month

children.heading: 去年 (Last year)
children.content: 去年卒業した "I graduated last year" Previous year

children.heading: さっき (A moment ago/Earlier)
children.content: さっき食べた "I ate a moment ago" さっき見た "I saw it earlier" Recent past Just now

children.heading: 先ほど (A while ago - Polite)
children.content: 先ほどお電話いただきました "You called a while ago" More formal than さっき

children.heading: 明日 (Tomorrow)
children.content: 明日行く "I'll go tomorrow" 明日は休みだ "Tomorrow is a day off" The next day

children.heading: あさって (The day after tomorrow)
children.content: あさって会おう "Let's meet the day after tomorrow" Two days from now

children.heading: 来週 (Next week)
children.content: 来週旅行する "I'll travel next week" Following week

children.heading: 来月 (Next month)
children.content: 来月引っ越す "I'll move next month" Following month

children.heading: 来年 (Next year)
children.content: 来年結婚する "I'll get married next year" Following year

children.heading: もうすぐ/すぐ (Soon)
children.content: もうすぐ着く "I'll arrive soon" すぐ行く "I'll go right away" Near future Immediate

children.heading: あとで/後で (Later)
children.content: あとで電話する "I'll call later" 後で会おう "Let's meet later" Some time later

children.heading: いつか (Someday)
children.content: いつか日本に行きたい "I want to go to Japan someday" Indefinite future

children.heading: 朝 (Morning)
children.content: 朝走る "I run in the morning" 今朝は寒かった "It was cold this morning" Morning time

children.heading: 昼 (Noon/Daytime)
children.content: 昼ごはんを食べる "Eat lunch" 昼間は暖かい "It's warm during the day" Midday

children.heading: 夜 (Night/Evening)
children.content: 夜勉強する "I study at night" 今夜出かける "I'm going out tonight" Evening/night time

children.heading: 午前/午後 (AM/PM)
children.content: 午前中に終わる "Finish in the morning (AM)" 午後3時に会う "Meet at 3 PM" Formal time divisions

children.heading: いつも (Always)
children.content: いつもここで食べる "I always eat here" Habitual time Every time

children.heading: たまに (Sometimes/Occasionally)
children.content: たまに映画を見る "I occasionally watch movies" Infrequent occurrence

children.heading: 最近 (Recently/Lately)
children.content: 最近忙しい "I'm busy lately" 最近よく会う "I often meet recently" Recent period

children.heading: 今頃 (About now/By now)
children.content: 今頃着いた頃だ "They should have arrived about now" Estimated current time

children.heading: まだ (Still/Yet)
children.content: まだ食べている "Still eating" まだ来ない "Haven't come yet" Continuing state With negative: not yet

children.heading: もう (Already/Yet)
children.content: もう食べた "Already ate" もう帰った "Already went home" Completed action Sooner than expected

children.heading: ずっと (All along/For a long time)
children.content: ずっと待っている "Have been waiting all along" ずっと好きだった "Have liked for a long time" Continuous duration

children.heading: 最初 (First/At first)
children.content: 最初は難しかった "It was difficult at first" Beginning point

children.heading: 次に (Next)
children.content: 次に説明します "I'll explain next" Following action

children.heading: 最後に (Finally/Lastly)
children.content: 最後に質問があります "Finally, I have a question" Final point

children.heading: その後 (After that)
children.content: その後、家に帰った "After that, I went home" Subsequent time

children.heading: 前 (Before/Ago)
children.content: 3年前 "3 years ago" 食べる前 "Before eating" Prior time point

children.heading: 後 (After/Later)
children.content: 3年後 "3 years later" 食べた後 "After eating" Following time point

children.heading: 間 (During/While)
children.content: 休み間 "During the break" Time span

children.heading: 今すぐ (Right now/Immediately)
children.content: 今すぐ行く "I'll go right now" Urgent immediacy

children.heading: 直ちに (Immediately - Formal)
children.content: 直ちに対応します "I'll respond immediately" Formal urgency

children.heading: 〜時 (When/At the time of)
children.content: 子供の時 "When I was a child" 来た時 "When I came" Time of occurrence

children.heading: 〜頃 (Around/About)
children.content: 3時頃 "Around 3 o'clock" その頃 "Around that time" Approximate time

children.heading: Usually at beginning or before verb
children.content: 昨日映画を見た "I watched a movie yesterday" 映画を昨日見た "I watched a movie yesterday" Flexible positioning

sections.heading: Multiple Time Expressions
sections.content: 昨日の夜 "Yesterday evening" 来週の月曜日 "Next Monday" 今年の夏 "This summer" Combining time words

children.heading: Confusing similar words
children.content: 今日 (kyou) "today" 今 (ima) "now" Different meanings Pay attention to readings

children.heading: Using に with time adverbs
children.content: Wrong: 昨日に ⚠️ Correct: 昨日 ✓ "Yesterday" Time adverbs don't need に (Exception: specific times like 3時に)

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 今行く "I'll go now" 昨日映画を見た "I watched a movie yesterday" 明日会いましょう "Let's meet tomorrow" 今日は暑い "It's hot today" 先週東京に行った "I went to Tokyo last week" 来年結婚する "I'll get married next year"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 昨日の夜、友達と食事をした。 とても楽しかった。明日も また会う予定だ。 "Last night I had dinner with friends. It was very fun. I plan to meet them again tomorrow." 最近とても忙しい。朝早く 起きて、夜遅くまで働いている。 来週からは少し楽になる 予定だ。 "I'm very busy lately. I wake up early in the morning and work until late at night. From next week, it's supposed to get a bit easier." 3年前に日本語の勉強を 始めた。最初はとても難しかったが、 今ではだいぶ話せるように なった。来年は日本に 留学したい。 "I started studying Japanese 3 years ago. At first it was very difficult, but now I've become able to speak fairly well. Next year I want to study abroad in Japan."
